t: Psalm 10
A Prayer for the Overthrow of the Wicked.
Why*pn do You stand afar off, O Lord?*s Why*ln do You hide Yourself*i in times of trouble?
In*ln pride the wicked hotly pursue the afflicted; Let*ln them be caught in the plots which they have devised.
For*ln the wicked boasts of his heart’s desire, And*ln the greedy man curses and*i spurns the Lord.*s
The*ln wicked, in the haughtiness of his countenance, does not seek Him.*i All*ln his thoughts are, “There is no God.”
His*ln ways prosper at all times; Your*ln judgments are on high, out of his sight; As*ln for all his adversaries, he snorts at them.
He*ln says to himself, “I will not be moved; Throughout*ln all generations I will not be in adversity.”
His*ln mouth is full of curses and deceit and oppression; Under*ln his tongue is mischief and wickedness.
He*ln sits in the lurking places of the villages; In*ln the hiding places he kills the innocent; His*ln eyes stealthily watch for the unfortunate.
He*ln lurks in a hiding place as a lion in his lair; He*ln lurks to catch the afflicted; He*ln catches the afflicted when he draws him into his net.
He*ln crouches, he bows down, And*ln the unfortunate fall by his mighty ones.
He*ln says to himself, “God has forgotten; He*ln has hidden His face; He will never see it.”
Arise,*ln O Lord;*s O God, lift up Your hand. Do*ln not forget the afflicted.
Why*ln has the wicked spurned God? He*ln has said to himself, “You will not require it.”*i
You*ln have seen it,*i for You have beheld mischief and vexation to take it into Your hand. The*ln unfortunate commits himself*i to You; You*ln have been the helper of the orphan.
Break*ln the arm of the wicked and the evildoer, Seek*ln out his wickedness until You find none.
The*ln Lord*s is King forever and ever; Nations*ln have perished from His land.
O*ln Lord,*s You have heard the desire of the humble; You*ln will strengthen their heart, You will incline Your ear
To*ln vindicate the orphan and the oppressed, So*ln that man who is of the earth will no longer cause terror.
